subtitles.transcript: There’s a lot of ways in which the University of California is able to say that they’re meeting
the promise that they’ve made to the state, but it doesn’t actually work out for students.
I think access in admissions is a key one. You know, they have a certain guarantee
that they’ve made to certain students that they’ll be able to get into a UC campus,
but, of course, it doesn’t mean that they can get into the campus of their choice and for
far too many students, it means they get admitted only into UC Merced, where few students want to go.
I think it’s something like two percent of referred students, students who applied to a different campus
and then were admitted to UC Merced, actually go there. That’s not real, meaningful access.
